alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 8:42PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hendricks, Marion and southern Boone Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Brownsburg, or 21 miles west of Indianapolis, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Brownsburg and Danville around 845 PM EDT. Plainfield around 855 PM EDT. Speedway around 900 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Beech Grove and Southport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 103 and 130. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 201. Interstate 70 between mile markers 71 and 93. Interstate 74 between mile markers 51 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
